page.title: 17Wem Post Office 1
page.content: The Wem Post Office is in the High Street, but the sorting office is in a side street called Leek Street. The garages for the vans and bicycles are there too.There are thirteen staff altogether, including nine postwomen and men. The counterstaff perform over a 100 different transactions from family allowance to issuing passports. The 5 postwomen work part time.They collect and deliver around Wem itself using bicycles. The 4 postmen work the rounds that cover the country around the town, and they all use vans. The postpeople clock in at 5 a.m. A lorry brings letters from Shrewsbury at 5.30 for the first delivery, then the postpeople sort out their rounds. At 7.3O am they start out on their rounds.
